website_summaries.verdict: A good floorstanding speaker that offers better sound quality and equalization than other budget models.
pros: Three surface woofers deliver better low and mid-range sound quality
One-inch soft-dome tweeter offers smooth high-frequency reproduction
Speaker cabinet helps to focus the sound while keeping the internal parts protected from dust and damage when not in use
cons: Speakers can cause some distortion depending on the stereo, connections, and type of audio

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself an audiophile and have been a pro musician for 30 years. These speakers totally exceeded my expectations, Ive had the complete 5.1 system for 5 years now and the sound is great in my home theatre for the total price of about $600. One thing I did was to raise these speakers up about 8 inches off the floor to get more ear level, Compare to Best Buy systems and these are a clear winner on price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Super sound, sexy lines, great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Needed some new stereo speakers for my living room after my old 80's vintage Allison Acoustics finally gave up the ghost. Put these in yesterday and I'm amazed by how good they sound. I'm a (starving) recording artist and spend a lot of time in studio-quality headphones so I know how music is supposed to sound out of speakers. For $200 a pair, it's hard to imagine getting much better. Excellent response all across the audible spectrum. Not boomy like a lot of powered speakers nowadays. Plays the TV nicely, but if you want earthquake-simulating ultra-lows for your movie experience you should probably look at some powered speakers that have a subwoofer with crossover. These are designed primarily for music.
customer_reviews.author: The Davinator

customer_reviews.title: What's with all those glowing reviews?
customer_reviews.text: Talk about lackluster sound. Where is the low end? Near as I can tell there isn't any. Midrange is nominal. Highs are lacking in any enjoyable luster. I'm listening to Miles Davis and keep wondering "Where is the life man?! How can these make Miles sound so lethargic!" I know the price point should temper expectations, but given the glowing reviews, I really had hopes for so much more than I'm hearing.
customer_reviews.author: David B Englund

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love these speakers
customer_reviews.text: Love these speakers for the price I just updated my 19 year old Pioneer receiver and wanted that crisp sound from some tower speakers. I will be adding the Dolby Atmos to it. Excited
customer_reviews.author: Tyeasha Tolliver

customer_reviews.title: All the sound I need in my 15x25 rec room
customer_reviews.text: I was considering numerous bookshelf speakers to pair up with my Onkyo 8020 receiver. However, I decided to go with these pioneer floor speakers in the hopes that I wouldn’t need to eventually add a subwoofer. I’m very happy with the purchase. These speakers deliver all the sound I need into my 15x25 rec area. They work well with all sources. I tend to run my TV and stream music via echo dot the most. Bottom line is that these floor speakers sound better than most higher end bookshelf speakers. And while I’ll probably still add a subwoofer at some point....I really don’t ‘need’ to.
customer_reviews.author: Ted L.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: The top end can be a little harsh with the wrong amplification, but overall a very nice sounding speaker. If your amp is somewhat clinical or unforgiving, you'll want to back off the treble a smidge, but if it's "musical", forgiving, and doesn't highlight every little flaw, these are great speakers. They paired nicely with a Cambridge Audio Topaz AM5. I even left them hooked up to my main receiver (which all the negative characteristics I mentioned) for a week and discovered I could live with them as my main speakers if I had to. Absolutely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alton Wroten

customer_reviews.title: Traded Blows with the Klipsch R-26F
customer_reviews.text: The fact that this speaker traded blows with the $295.99 Klipsch R-26F and is selling at a 3rd of the price is unreal. This little speaker was able to output a nice amount of bass and keep it's clarify at higher volumes (unlike the Polk T30). Sound quality was almost discernible from the Klipsch R-26, it just couldn't keep up with the clarity of sound reproduction that the R-26F could push out. At the end of the day, I did go with the R-26F due to the sound quality. If you're on a budget, you will be getting a huge value with this speaker.
customer_reviews.author: EvanJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound! I bought 2 and use them replacements to damaged left and right speakers in my SS set up with Boston center and bookshelf surround speakers. More sound than I was expecting! For me it completely eliminated the need for a subwoofer. It would be nice to have a sub but I can live without one...for now. I am sure their are better sounding speakers on the market but not in this price range. These offer plenty of room filling clear sound and enough bass and mid range to keep the intended cinematic experience pure. I Love these speakers!
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Bought used, should’ve bought new.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased used, as the listing stated “ Small cosmetic imperfection on top, front or sides of the item.” When it arrived I found no cosmetic imperfections, but terrible distorted sound from the tweeter. The speaker was paired with a 6ohm 100w amplifier, and music was being played at a low volume. This would suggest a busted tweeter. I’ve contacted amazon and they’ve yet to rectify this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Omg, shoes

customer_reviews.title: Much Ado About Nothing
customer_reviews.text: Note to self: Stop looking to Amazon reviews for buying guidance! Look to professional audio reviews. I really don’t get. I’m not an audio snob but to my ears, even after much EQ, these never hit the mark. But you know for the price you guys that wrote the raving reviews, go ahead and enjoy the heck out of them. My 25 year old Paradigms will be put back in use until I can improve on them. These are going back.
customer_reviews.author: LCS007

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound, economically priced
customer_reviews.text: I have these speakers paired with the Yamaha RN-303 receiver and Yamaha S 300 CD player, a no non sense very easy set up that produces great sound with plenty of bass as well as mid and highs. For my quarintine playlist i played the following cds through the speakers: Buckethead- The Light in the Fog, Dew Drops and Claymation Courtyard. Joe Satriani- Thunder High on the Mountain. Stuart Hamm- Remember Phil Collins- We Wait and We Wonder. Take my quarintine challenge listed above with those songs and these speakers....you might not want to go out in society ever again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ben K.

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers
customer_reviews.text: Very good speakers, they sound great for my home theater 5.1 system. It was between these and a pair of comparable polk's. Of course when I wanted them it seems everyone on earth wanted them so the price went up, at the time the Polks went up a little higher. I bought a pair, no regrets. I would buy again. For some reason the post office was used to deliver two of these speakers and they delivered them to my driveway, without notifying anyone inside they had. Dark early in winter, went to take trash out, surprise speakers sitting in driveway.
customer_reviews.author: ty_gi

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pairing With My MTX
customer_reviews.text: Many years (decades?) ago, I bought a pair of MTX Monitor10s. Little did anyone back then realize just how good MTXs were. I certainly didn't. So I wanted to get another pair to match with them through my Onkyo receiver. Well, they stopped making them a long time ago. So I wanted to get a pair or floor speakers that would be in the ballpark without breaking the bank. So after a great deal of research, I decided on these Pioneer SP-FS52 Andrew Jones. NO! They are not as good as my MTXs. But I am indeed pleased. Compared with my MTX pair, the Pioneers rate 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what the reviews are about?
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had these going on a year. Bought them considering all the rave reviews and the fact that my in wall speakers are great, but was lacking in breadth when it came to music. The BIC AMERICA in walls are substantially better. The pioneers have great mid range sound, but that’s it. The highs are shrill and the lows are non existent. I’m not quite sure how they got such great reviews, maybe my Yamaha isn’t pushing enough power, but I doubt it. When the wife okays it, will definitely be investing in to more BIC America’s for the floor standing speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Day

customer_reviews.title: Andrew Jones is Da BOMB
customer_reviews.text: Paired with a center channel and a pair of bookshelf speakers from the same series (and my old sony subwoofer) this was an EXCELLENT upgrade to my sound system. already running a Pioneer Elite receiver The posts through me off because I couldn't insert banana plugs, but then I realized there were caps on them, just unscrew the outer terminal, remove the cap and plug away!
customer_reviews.author: TheElderGodFather

customer_reviews.title: Solid speaker, GREAT value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Pioneer VSX-832 receiver, these Andrew Jones towers, the Andrew Jones Center and Rear speakers and added the Yamaha YST-SW315 subwoofer. Wired with 14 gauge wiring, sub with a single RCA, audio comes in from the TV with an HDMI. These speakers want at least 100watts, and this setup delivers a sufficient 165watts at 6ohms. This setup has more than delivered on its value, you won’t find better speakers at this price point, just make sure that you are not under powering them.
customer_reviews.author: BRANDON MCLAUGHLIN

customer_reviews.title: Very good main LR speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome entry level speakers. Bought as part of the 5.1 kit. Best sounding speakers I've heard under $1k. I'm using 2 of these along with 2 AJ subs and 4 AJ bookshelf surrounds in a 7.2.4 setup. The .4 are Polk Audio Atrium 4 speakers mounted to the ceiling as overhead Dolby Atmos speaakers. The setup sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: wildswing

customer_reviews.title: Deep Mass appeal, too thin where it counts
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is designed for mass appeal - bottom heavy tuning, noticeably shallow in the middle. It sounds good, but not great. The name attached to it has risen my expectations, so I'm somewhat disappointed, especially since it costs more than the competing entry level Sony, which is a fine HiFi speaker in the less than $600 price range. So, I'm keeping my Sony, and will gift these to a friend with lesser discerning ears.
customer_reviews.author: L. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: ... have had for 20 years and this were the best I had heard while shopping
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for new speakers for a while to replace the speakers I have had for 20 years and this were the best I had heard while shopping. I listened to speakers that were priced much more than the Pioneers that did not sound near as good as they did. The speakers do need a break in period and sound even better after about 20 hours or so. I am going to get the bookshelf version to use as the rears in my home theater setup.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Clendenen

customer_reviews.title: but for sitting they're at perfect height, the top driver is just below ear ...
customer_reviews.text: See my review for the SP-C22. Also, some people say they needed something to stand these on to raise them up, but for sitting they're at perfect height, the top driver is just below ear level.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Nice, warm, good for the price
customer_reviews.text: These have a very rich, warm sound. They're not huge, but when driven well they can put out a good amount of sound to fill a large room without unpleasant distortion. Clarity is good, but not excellent. Some instruments and vocals will get blended together with these speakers, while you might be able to tease them apart more distinctly with more expensive speakers. Still, they are pleasant to listen to and a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: ronparr

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I typically have buyer's remorse, but not with these speakers. I have a 7.2 setup for home theater with my 120" screen and projector. Seriously for the price, there is no comparison. I visited several home theater stores to test speakers out, and I looked at speakers four and five times the amount of these, but in the end I much preferred these. I considered a wireless klipsch 5.1 system that sounded amazing, but it was around $5000! Instead, I was able to get an awesome 7.2 system for around $750! This system shakes my house and for the price the sound is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Josh B.

customer_reviews.title: An excellent sounding speaker for music or movies
customer_reviews.text: I love these speakers. They have good bass by themselves, but a subwoofer definitely helps them get deeper for movie special effects. Their overall sound for music is very balanced and smooth, not harsh or too subdued . A definite buy for a small intimate room. I have speakers that cost me 5X as much, and they don't sound greatly better unless you are playing really loud, which I rarely do. These are the best inexpensive speakers I have ever owned, or listened to anywhere. They sound even better when placed on a speaker stand , to get the speaker closer to ear level when you are seated, along with a good sub woofer.
customer_reviews.author: ampgreen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I had an old pair of Pioneer bookshelf speakers that I'd used for years and loved, but were pretty beat up to look at. I went Pioneer again for these hoping for perfection. Wow, was I disappointed. Bass is nonexistent, sound overall is what I'd describe as 'tinny.' I can't believe the high reviews these have, they are not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: I thought these speakers would sound great, but to me, they sounded flat, somewhat mumbling. There was ok bass, but I like the highs too: cymbals, horns, keyboards, pianos. To me there wasn't much of that. I don't know how to call it, brilliance, sparkle?. It's as if your bass control was up, but the treble was turned down. My Sony floor speakers, which I was going to replace with these, to me sounded better, more higher end. Too bad you can't hear them before buying them. Also too bad, I liked the way they looked. My two cents.
customer_reviews.author: TVMAN

customer_reviews.title: Good value but.....
customer_reviews.text: The Onkyo SKF-4800 is a better speaker. The Pioneers are not bad speakers. They are well made, look great, and sound good. Great for a beginner who wants good sound but who also needs to watch the cost. BUT. Comparing them to the Onkyos the difference shows their lack of bass. The Onkyos sounded clearer as well. The catch is cost. The Pioneers are typically 200 bucks per pair, which is reasonable. But you can find the Onkyos for about 10-15% more they are the better choice. Again, the Pioneers are good speakers for the money. But there are better speakers out there for a little more money.
customer_reviews.author: J. G. McGraw

customer_reviews.title: a+
customer_reviews.text: Blown away by the quality at this price point. I wanted a simple 2.1 set up for my medium/large living room and these are perfect. We watched a movie last night and my wife and I were so happy with how it sounded in stereo. Been listening to music today and they are wonderful. We were between these and the T50’s and I’m glad we went with these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely pleased with these speakers
customer_reviews.text: Using a pair of these speakers in a 12' x 18' room with a 100W per channel receiver and a subwoofer, mostly for watching TV and sometimes for listening to music (rock, jazz, classical). I am extremely pleased with these speakers, nicely articulate but not at all harsh with the TV. I haven't listened to these speakers much without the subwoofer (Onkyo SKW204), but with the subwoofer the sound is absolutely superb, I am extremely pleased! And good grief, the price is right......
customer_reviews.author: Peter Williams

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe the sound
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound great. I mean great. I feel like just listening to music. Seriously, you are going to listen to music that you have heard a thousand times and think Wow. I never heard that before.
customer_reviews.author: Rohin Banerji

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable sound - great value!
customer_reviews.text: 1 1/2 years after purchase, I'm still very impressed with the sound quality of the Pioneer Andrew Jones speakers. These work well for both movie surround sound and music. Nice balance of highs, mid-range and bass. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the money it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.text: So i'm just writing my review after 6 years. They are a entry level audiophile speaker. For the money I piad I argue they can't be beat. You can drive them hard and they take it all. I have a Klipsch sub paired with them and they sound great. I've herd speakers hundreds more and they do sound better. But not that much better. If your just getting started you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Amick

customer_reviews.title: Incredible speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of contemplating, I pulled the trigger on purchasing these floor standing speakers as my fronts in 5.1 channel setup. I must say that I am very impressed with the output from these speakers. They are well built and produce warm natural sound with no distortion. More importantly, I didn't have to pay a fortune to get them delivered at my doorstep and to get quality sound output. Thanks to Amazon Prime for a safe quick delivery. Must buy for anyone looking forward to high quality sound at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: NY

customer_reviews.title: I believe it’s a great speaker for the price
customer_reviews.text: It does like the mid range but who really listens to that anyway unless you have an ear for it. Do you have to step up in price pretty good to find that I believe but I’m not pretending to be any expert I’m just excited to have a seven channel stereo system again..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research prior to purchase and while I didn't listen to all the others the reviews on Amazon, CNET and other rated these the best. While my first inclination was not Pioneer, they sound crisp and clean with good highs. I have a sub so really can't comment on the base, but did read where they were not the best for base. Looked at Polk, Sony and Boston to compare.
customer_reviews.author: BSchr

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Amazing!!! I have Polks RtiA7 and if I compared them for the price at $97 I payed for each vs $550 on the Polk and its totally worthy. If you are new into home theater and music. This is the best speaker for its price! And i have vast experience with good speakers. I own polks rti, polk monitor 40, definitive technology and Monitor Audio Silvers.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Powering these with a Cambridge Audio Topaz AM10 and easily driving them to 90db with clean deep bass, engaging midrange and sweet treble. Treble depending on your source can be a bit forward. I just adjusted the Topaz treble to -2db. Hooked up a Rega RP1 turntable to the phono section and it sounds great. Really recommend these Speakers. But feed them well 50w to 100w of good clean power to make them sing.
customer_reviews.author: William S. Seaberry

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Keep having to remind myself how cheap these are. Nice slim size. Very balanced, smooth sound with vinyl, streaming and CD. Plenty of base for music, using in simple stereo hookup just for music. I've got various higher end speakers in my work but don't feeling I missing anything for music with these. If you are watching movies, a full 5.1 would make sense but two channel music, a pair of these is all you need for most normal size rooms in homes.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Van Vuuren

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound at 1/4 of similar spec'd speaker sets!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a package with the rest of the speaker set. Amazing sound for the money. I paired this up with a Denon AVR-S510BT 5.2 channel 4k receiver and it's killing it! Easily out performs similar systems at 1/4 of the price. If you are looking for entry level price but solid over performing sound, this is the set. Highly recommend the Andrew Jones package.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best entry-level speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing these, I did my extensive research on speakers. It is hard to beat the price of these speakers. One of the best entry-level speakers for home theater!
customer_reviews.author: Milka

customer_reviews.title: I can't say nothing about these speakers they found great highs mids and bass
customer_reviews.text: Great Value great sounding speaker sounds great makes a great home theater speaker they have a little bit of everything all packed into one product I am really enjoying them they're great for listening to music and grateful looking at movies with a surround sound system I definitely must have if you're looking for home theater speakers you can't go wrong with these
customer_reviews.author: reonard

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker Value-Awesome sound!
customer_reviews.text: After many reviews, of reviews, I replaced my OLD Mirage IM-9 towers and these were as advertised! Great imaging, sound stage, warmth especially for vinyl records, good bass but could use a sub for home theater use which is only about 10% for me as I use mostly as 2 channel music system , with a switch to 3.1 with movies and TV- The sound really is a a reach out and touch/-3D soundstage. So worth much more than what they cost- Very pleased with my purchase-
customer_reviews.author: Scott Murr

customer_reviews.title: Dang
customer_reviews.text: Excellent towers for the price. By far the best you’re going to get at this price range. The build quality is meh, but the sound quality competes with towers 2-3 times it’s price.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've paid twice as much in the past for less, only thing I would highly suggest is to run them in combination with a sub. I've switched my sub on and off while listening to these speakers and the sub clearly fills in some missing low end gaps. You might be able to EQ in a little more bass, but really a sub is the best answer
customer_reviews.author: 3dprnt

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good sound, sort of cheesy looks.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I'm extremely pleased with these speakers. The sound is solid, for sure. I just wish the enclosures didn't have that thin-soon-to-get-scratched-and-peel-off fake wood-grain black coating, makes my living room look like a college apartment. But - they sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Max's Dad

customer_reviews.title: There Is A Reason This Is Best Seller!
customer_reviews.text: I am an audio guy. Put in systems for concerts, churches, radio stations. Man, am I still surprised at the quality of these speakers. Lows and high with every thing in between is right where you need it to be. The quality of the wood casing is amazing. Wood sounds better and Pioneer knows it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Harshbarger

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the price was great and over all the sound and design are excellent. service and shipping from Beach Camera were fast!
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Let them break in
customer_reviews.text: Great set of speakers I got a year ago on sale new. I seen a review that mentioned "breaking them in". I'm not sure this is a thing, but i left my e.q. flat and didn't use them hard for a few months. I did notice that the sound quality got better over time. Not that its bad to begin with, but it just got better. The enclosures are sturdy, look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Awesome speakers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Andrew Jones system, center, sub and bookshelf speakers but decided on 4 bookshelf speakers. I found the bookshelf just didn't give me the sound I was looking for front left / right. The towers complete the package. The highs are crisp and the lows coupled with the sub is outstanding. At this price point you can not go wrong with these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: RLO

customer_reviews.title: They Sound Great
customer_reviews.text: What a difference these made! Sure there are better speakers out there, but for 100.00 there is no way they can be beat. They replaced an older onkyo set I have had for years, and they sound so much better. My 7.1 theater system never sounded so good. One of the best deals I have ever made. Thanks Pioneer and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: pitbullman216

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular Speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Sitting here listening to Neil Young Harvest like he's actually playing in my living room. The clarity and color of sound these speakers produce is incredible. Matched with a Yamaha R-S202 Natural Sound Receiver, it's like I'm hearing my albums and CDs for the first time through a new set of ears. I'm overjoyed with the choice to purchase these Pioneer SP-FS52 speakers. Warm and rich sound, exceptional crossover, better than anything I listened to back in the 70's and the heyday of home Hi Fi.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, affordable
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this set of speakers. They sounded great once they broke in. It does mention in the instructions that they have to loosen up a bit with some use before they will sound right, and I thought this was true. A couple of things- they are an odd shape and the instructions say to place them some distance from the wall which is inconvenient compared with an ordinary rectangular speaker. However, I wanted better sound and I got it, so I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul from Santa Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Amazon Customer Service and Thanks Mrs Jen P
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 Pioneer SF-FS52 since November 2016 at the same time Onkyo A-9010 Missed one cover of Loudspeakers.(!!?) Called Amazon Customer Service and received a new replacement Loudspeaker next day at no additional charge, Excellent Amazon Customer Service and Thanks Mrs Jen P. These products are a lot better than I expected it to be. Excellent quality, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: PNGUYEN

customer_reviews.title: Mixing the old with the new it was a good decision. A lot depend on what goes in ...
customer_reviews.text: Paired them with a 1976 Pioneer SX7750 receiver. A lot of people classify this receiver as a "warm" receiver, due to it's sound characteristics. Let me tell you... It blew my ears away. Mixing the old with the new it was a good decision. A lot depend on what goes in into these speakers. I will not get technical with the receiver specifications, but if you listen to anything from Norah Jones, to Andrea Bocelli, to The Egles, to Lynynd Skynyrd, be ready for a tight, smooth bass, vocals as if you were first row and warm, not ear piercing highs. Your ears will thank you...
customer_reviews.author: FlyLowHitHardDad

customer_reviews.title: Definitive audiophile quality from these!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tower speakers! Pioneer and andrew jones outdid themselves with this one! Ive got a pair of these hooked to an onkyo tx-sr373 and with a dayton audio sub-1500 15” powered sub. The soundstage is really nice, the bass is clean and strong and the clarity from that soft dome tweeter is very very detailed. As far as sound goes, this is audiophile level when connected to the right reciever. Aesthetics wise, its also a winner in my book with the grill on or off. Would definitely buy again if ever needed!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Evangelista

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and quality! Collect the whole set!!
customer_reviews.text: This system is well worth the money for a budget theater system!! I will have to hand it to Pioneer, they made a quality brand speaker system!
customer_reviews.author: Silverplated

customer_reviews.title: Good sound great value
customer_reviews.text: If your doing a stereo on a budget, these are for you! Only draw back is a sub is needed but even buying 2 towers and the sub still come in under $400! $650 up is where quality sound usually starts, not with the Andrew Jones designed Pioneer tower and sub!
customer_reviews.author: Fred K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: "For the money these are great". The bass pops way more than i expected nice and tight. the first song i played was new Tool, awesome. I am going to buy 2 more asap, Amazon is sold out now. Packaging was great no damage. You cant build your own for this amount of money and have this quality. Nice crossover. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat this value!
customer_reviews.text: Pair these with some good speaker wires and amp and grin everytime you turn them on. For $99 each I dont think there is a better deal out there. Andrew Jones is a speaker King and these prove it. If you are putting together a solid budget minded setup I highly recommended these. Very solid build and in person look great too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have to say these are the best sounding speakers I have purchased. They sound incredible and deliver rich full range sound. I would buy them again in a heartbeat. I used to have a pair of Yamaha bookshelf speakers, which I thought sounded good, but after listening to these they are awesome, it's like a I have a whole new stereo. In fact my wife thought the sub was on the first time I used them without the sub. Played Bach's Toccata and Fugue in D minor, I thought the organ was in my living room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck !
customer_reviews.text: awesome sound for your money, no need to go high tech, these speakers do the job they were made for, trust me, your room, your ears, where you sit, so many variables will change what you hear from those high tech, high cost speakers. These are just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W Mulherin

customer_reviews.title: and pretty good lows
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding highs and mids, and pretty good lows... we've had complaints from the neighbors. Bought two, no subwoofer, would do so again.
customer_reviews.author: Ana A.

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers a month ago and I couldn't be happier with them. I use them for both listening to music and watching TV as solely stereo speakers. Mid & high ranges couldn't be more crisp and audible. The bass could be a little stronger but it's still surprisingly deep when it needs to be, like when there's an explosion during a movie. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: great speaker if you are chillin to some Etta James
customer_reviews.text: These are pioneer speakers.one expects the best.especially a signature series.(andrew jones) my listening room is 16' × 16' . The clarity is above and beyond expectations as well as head room. Beautiful sound. They ran comfortably to my ears for hours . through a sx 3800 receiver. 120 watts. Let me add that if you want high volume that blows the top of yor head off, these are not designed for that. Grab the ol lady a glass of wine and enjoy. Not for Motorhead !! Lugs for speak wire are too small for man hands.
customer_reviews.author: James i.

customer_reviews.title: seriously?
customer_reviews.text: I am kicking myself as I type, because I only bought 2!! These speakers are amazing! Loudspeaker? Loud is one thing but what good is loud if it isn't clear. Should have been called "crystal speaker", because that's how clear the sound is. Absolutely amazing. I had a sub from before and now my house sounds like Deadmau5 is performing in my living room... From a block away! Bottom line, if your speaker shopping, look no further. Thank you Pioneer!
customer_reviews.author: B. South

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for our entertainment center and paired it with a Yamaha RX-V679BL AV receiver. They sound excellent for all purposes, whether we're listening to music, watching TV or movies, or playing video games. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: David T. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: THESE CAPTURE THE ESSENCE OF MUSIC AND MOVIES!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I REPLACED AN OLD PAIR OF LINN SARA 9 (3000.00) WITH THESE BEAUTIES. IT TOOK LESS THAN 10 HOURS TO BREAK THESE IN AND START ENJOYING PHENOMINAL REPRODUCTION OF MUSIC. THE SOUND STAGE WAGE LARGE DEEP AND WIDE. THE DETAILS THESE PRODUCED MATCHED MY 3000.00 SPEAKERS. I USED BANANA PLUGS AND AN ONKYO TX-NR515 AVR 100WT PER CHANNEL.. MY MAIN SOURCE OF MUSIC WAS A REGA TURNTABLE THE VOICES FELT LIKE THEY WERE IN MY LIVINGROOM. THE SOUND ARRANGEMENT WAS ACCURATE AND WELL A PLEASURE TO LISTEN TO. IF YOUR ON THE FENCE ABOUT THESE, JUMP OFF AND GET ON AMAZON AND ORDER THESE!!! DONT LIKE EM I WILL BUY THEM HAVE FUN!!
customer_reviews.author: phillip smith

customer_reviews.title: refined value
customer_reviews.text: These are VERY well designed (Thank you, Andrew Jones) and refined. What I mean by refined is that I've compared them to a similar Infinity (a GOOD speaker maker) of similar size. Despite having more cone area, the Infinity has a mid-bass boom that doesn't exist on the Pioneers. Though they're a few dollars more than the Infinity, they are a better speaker, overall; they ARE worth the extra $30 or whatever it was. These are "keepers" ... and, yes, I would buy them, again ... in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Discoveror

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome
customer_reviews.text: The sound is simply awesome! These speakers competes with high end very expensive brands and give them a run for tmoney. It is very hard, if not impossible, not to fall in love with these once you hear them. Unless you are looking for servo woofers or Diamond tweeters, you search for good speakers end here. Allow them to break in. Also look at wattage. Receivers will too low watts will not be able to drive these for good sound, higher watts may need the Elite model, which are another jewel from AJ
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay

customer_reviews.title: They deliver. Phenomenal value.
customer_reviews.text: Blown away. I'm glad I listened to the reviews. For the money, you won't be disappointed. I've demo'd the most expensive Golden Ears, and swore I'd buy them, but I had to try these, at 1/20th the cost. Turned off my subwoofer, and couldn't believe it wasn't still on. Unbelievable bass from these things. I'm thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Z

customer_reviews.title: Great mid range speaker
customer_reviews.text: Returned, listened to it for a week, got to get bigger speakers, or a subwoofer. I prefer a classic JBL 3 way speaker, less land mines in the living room that way.
customer_reviews.author: RKR

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought these things. Sound quality is great. Materials are great. Aesthetically pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: Zargon

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a couple of months ago and I am very happy with them. The low bass issue that some people mentioned could be easily fixed by enhancing the bass on the receiver. They are perfect for a home stereo, unless perhaps you have very discriminating ears, which I don't. As we age the range of frequencies we can hear become more limited. I mostly play mp3's anyway.
customer_reviews.author: "stravinsky2"

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: I put these as my front surrounds and to break them in a bit I let them play just by themselves and did other things. I could not believe what i was hearing was just from these speakers! Nice full sound and plenty of bass.
customer_reviews.author: Crispee

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer still strong and in the game !
customer_reviews.text: Great product design and sound ! Shoulda bought it when I daw it...the first time,50dols less. But Pioneer is still strong and in the game !
customer_reviews.author: E.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound of these speakers. I did a lot of reading online before buying these. These were rated by several reviewers as a higher end speaker with a lower end cost. They were right! These sound awesome. No distortion at high levels, they fill the room with clarity at all levels.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Talks

customer_reviews.title: ... to put this - these speakers are simply a great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: There's no other way to put this - these speakers are simply a great value for the price! Reference-quality sound, inoffensive visually. I've purchased a pile of these speakers for myself and my friends. I simply have not found anything comparable to these for less than $500. They're not going to muscle you out of the house by any means, but these are hungry enough to be overbearingly loud in a medium sized room if you give them enough juice. If you're a first-timer trying to design a decent audio system, these things are great for home theater and/or casual listening.
customer_reviews.author: B. Morris

customer_reviews.title: great speakers by a fantastic designer
customer_reviews.text: These we a great buy--the designer usually does much hight end speakers but for the $ they are fantastic and they seem to just keep getting better.
customer_reviews.author: timothy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound, great value
customer_reviews.text: Was down to the Polk T50s and these and went with these, no regrets! Used with my home theater setup, 2 paired with my Denon A/V receiver; sound is excellent. Easy to set up, including cutting my own wires!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I love these speakers. They take up a lot of space but the sound quality is great and I have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding speakers (Floor standing model)
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these (they are sold separately) and hooked them up to my receiver with no other additions (subwoofer, other speakers). I was floored by the sound quality and spent the next few hours listening to all types of music genres. It was a whole new experience even with songs I had heard a hundred times before. For the price, I'd recommend this speaker hands down. The overall looks of the cabinet and the cones are pretty standard and aren't much to look at.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bystrom

customer_reviews.title: They sound great, and I'm pretty sure that currently for the ...
customer_reviews.text: I've got 2 of these hooked up to a Cambridge Topaz AM10. They sound great, and I'm pretty sure that currently for the price, these can't be beaten. I've also got the Pioneer Andrew Jones soundbar system hooked up to my TV. So far for me, this whole range is amazing quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Turley

customer_reviews.title: ended up with a pretty nice 2.1 system
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these ($89.99) matched it with the SW-8MK2 sub($99.99) from the same line, all hooked up to the Sony STRDH550 ($149.99) plus wires/banana plugs etc, and ended up with a pretty nice 2.1 setup for under $500 with room to grow into a 5.1 if I ever wanted to. Having only used budget htiab sets from years ago, this set up sounds great!
customer_reviews.author: Fletch

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great sound compared to my old Bose 3-2-1 system I've been using for years
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: $500 quality for $100
customer_reviews.text: Just what it says....these may be the most amazing speakers I've ever purchased at such a great price and what you get is the quality of a $1000 pair of speakers. They come as 1, so you will need to purchase 2 BUT these are so worth it for someone who wants to upgrade their systems....and from someone with an extensive Home Theater background, these will do you quite well.....just make sure you have or get a receiver w/ Audyssey so that the system will calibrate the speakers and your room correction levels. Amazing and would recommend to anyone who wants some great quality speakers but doesn't want to break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Munge

customer_reviews.title: Lackluster tonality
customer_reviews.text: Compared to a pair of similarly priced Polk Audio Monitor 60 II - these speakers sound lackluster.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These are simply awesome speakers for the price! Pioneer is not who I immediately think of when talking "inexpensive" speakers, but there is serious engineering in these to get the sound they produce at their sale price. They are very, very, clear and precise. They don't produce a ton of bass, but it's reasonable considering the size of the towers. Add a sub if you want punching low notes. A great speaker that I'd buy again in a heartbeat. I also bought the center which is of equal quality.
customer_reviews.author: Hud

customer_reviews.title: Way beyond what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. So I installed them (easy) and put on a country station on Pandora, and I wasn't so impressed. So I switched to a classical station. When I was a kid my favorite way to listen to the piano was lying under it while a very good pianist played. I got that same sound today from these speakers. And now listening to a cello with the same sharp clear quality. When you can hear key strikes and bow movement you have a great set of speakers. These speakers far exceed my expectations, and I don't even have the sub bass plugged in yet. So worth their very reasonable cost!
customer_reviews.author: David W Skibbins

customer_reviews.title: Great sound great price
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers for a GREAT price! Love the look of them and they’re perfect for my downstairs living space. So satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J.V.

customer_reviews.title: They sound great!
customer_reviews.text: Wow these speakers sound really good! Glad I bought them. I had others over $600.00 over time but these sound just has good as those.
customer_reviews.author: Roy M.

customer_reviews.title: good purchase
customer_reviews.text: maybe it's just my layout and that these things look great with it, but I replaced some other speakers that really worked just fine because I liked the look of these. yup, good call
customer_reviews.author: JonnyB

customer_reviews.title: Great sound at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Great sound at an affordable price. Now notice a lot of sounds we never did with our old speakers. Really enjoy them
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Best budget speakers I have heard. Sounds like a higher end speaker than the price reflects.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Well done pioneer
customer_reviews.text: Five stars based on price point. Pretty crisp and clean sound that can get fairly loud. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Lednik

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding Speakers at a Phenomenal Price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers to replace some 80's era floor speakers and the difference in sound was unbelievable, not to mention the price. Back in the day you would've had to of spent thousands for speakers that sounds good.
customer_reviews.author: stevedee

customer_reviews.title: amazon
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers Amazon fast delivery but found better price sorry Amazon your great service
customer_reviews.author: william yulfo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing floor standing speaker.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing floor standing speakers. I love this set. It's probably the best value for your money out there. The look nice, too.
customer_reviews.author: John Marshall

customer_reviews.title: They simply amaze. I have them paired with their bookshelf cousins ...
customer_reviews.text: At this price point, I have never heard a speaker with this kind of quality. They simply amaze. I have them paired with their bookshelf cousins (as surround speakers) and the sound is exceptional. Once set up correctly with a solid receiver, these things compare to systems costing in the thousands.
customer_reviews.author: EW20

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my current front speakers from Energy Take classic 5.1 ( highly rated compact system) with these budget floor standing speakers. Huge difference both in music and movie. Great speakers for under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They sound awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These sound awesome and added the missing mids and base I've been wanting great with my Sony strdh770
customer_reviews.author: Katie H

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding inexpensive speaker out there
customer_reviews.text: These speakers have such clarity and detail, I'm still shocked at how inexpensive they are.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Y.

product_meta.title: Pioneer SP-FS52 Home Audio Andrew Jones Designed Floor Standing Loudspeaker
product_meta.description: Style:Floor Standing SpeakerPioneer SP-FS52 Home Audio Andrew Jones Designed Floor Standing Loudspeaker. Highly acclaimed and award winning series of speakers designed by world-renowned speaker engineer Andrew Jones. The SP-FS52 floor standing speakers were designed to offer extraordinary performance and remarkable sound quality for music and home theater at an affordable price.
feature_bullets: ANDREW JONES. From speaker designer Andrew Jones comes a collection of speakers that bring professional-quality sound to your living room. These highly-acclaimed bookshelf loudspeakers deliver on sound, creating an immersive listening experience.
CURVED DESIGN. These speakers utilize a RF Molded Curved Cabinets design to reduce internal standing waves, resulting in high-performance and exceptional sound quality.
FEEL THE BASS. A structured surface with oversized magnets improves rigidity and bass accuracy. A vented pole piece also improves bass response for deep, beautiful sound.

TWEETER EFFICIENCY. To widen the sweet spot of the 1-inch High Efficiency Soft Dome tweeter, we’ve engineered a custom wave guide. Increasing tweeter efficiency, together an 8-Element Complex Crossover, allows the SP-FS52 to bring the sound.
COMPLEX CROSSOVER. 8 Element Complex Crossover perfectly blends audio between the woofer and tweeter for greater accuracy.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars847 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
